recipes.title: Goulash
recipes.creator: Audrey S.
instructions: Brown hamburger and add Italian seasoning.
Drain.
While browning hamburger cook noodles according to package directions.
In a medium roasting dish or 3 quart dish combine hamburger, noodles, tomato paste, and tomatoes.
Heat oven to 350°.
Layer cheeses on top of mixture.
Cover and bake for approximately 1 to 1 ½ hours.
recipes.notes: Makes 5-6 servings. Substitutions: can use pint jar of chunky salsa for extra flavoring, for 1 can cooked peeled tomatoes.

recipes.title: Lefse
recipes.creator: Audrey S.
instructions: Boil and mash potatoes.
Cool.
Add lard, salt, and flour.
Roll as thin as possible.
Bake on lefse grill or griddle until light brown, turning frequently to prevent scorching.
You may use a wide metal spatula or paint stir stick.

recipes.title: Rhubarb Crisp
recipes.creator: Audrey S.
instructions: Line a greased tin pan (9X13) with sugar, egg, and 6 TBLS flour (mixed together).
Layer rhubarb over first mixture.
Combine rest of ingredients and spread over rhubarb.
Do Not pat down.
Bake at 350° for about 1 hour.
Cool for a while or serve warm with ice cream.

recipes.title: Strawberry Shortcake Casserole
recipes.creator: Audrey S.
instructions: To make cream layer, beat cream cheese and add eggs one at a time.
Scrape sides of bowl and add the sour cream, vanilla, milk, brown sugar, and white sugar.
Mix well.
Layer half of the French bread (torn in bite-sized pieces) into buttered casserole dish.
Next layer half of frozen strawberries over bread, then half of cream mixture.
Repeat, and refrigerate 3-5 hours.
Preheat oven to 350° and remove casserole from refrigerator, return to room temp.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 min.
Uncover and bake an additional 20 min.
Insert knife to check if done.

recipes.title: Play-doh
recipes.creator: Audrey S.
instructions: Mix well and cook for 2-3 min.
Stir in food coloring.
Play-doh will stay soft if kept in ziplock bag.

recipes.title: Allie’s Favorite Hotdish
recipes.creator: Audrey S.
instructions: Brown hamburger and onion.
Drain.
Cook macaroni according to package directions.
Mix all ingredients together and bake at 350° for 45 min.

recipes.title: Turkey Hotdish
recipes.creator: Audrey S.
ingredients: 10 oz can cream of chicken soup
instructions: Prepare stuffing according to package.
Layer stuffing and turkey or chicken in a 9X9 pan.
Mix soup and milk, pour over stuffing and meat.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
Cover for first 30 min and uncover for remaining time.
Double recipe for 9X13 pan.
recipes.notes: Serves 3-4.

recipes.title: Beef Stew
recipes.creator: Audrey V.
instructions: Cut vegetables and mix with beef.
Add water to the mixture.
If the mixture is runny, add a cornstarch/water mixture to thicken.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
recipes.notes: Adjust thickness as desired using cornstarch.

recipes.title: Cabbage Hotdish
recipes.creator: Audrey V.
instructions: Brown onion and hamburger.
Place cabbage in a buttered casserole dish.
Put the meat and onion mixture on top of the cabbage.
Spread tomato soup over the top.
Cover and bake at 350°F for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until the cabbage is done.
recipes.notes: Ensure cabbage is fully cooked before serving.

recipes.title: Taco Casserole
recipes.creator: Audrey V.
instructions: Brown hamburger with onion and drain.
Add tomato sauce and dry taco seasoning to the meat.
Butter a 9x13 pan.
Place crushed corn chips in the bottom of the pan.
Put the meat mixture on top of the chips.
Layer in the following order: cottage cheese, sour cream, cheddar cheese, Monterey cheese.
Top with ripe olives.
Bake uncovered at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
recipes.notes: Layer ingredients as directed for best results.

recipes.title: Snicker’s Salad
recipes.creator: Barb S.
ingredients: 2 large red apples, pared and cubed
2 king-size Snicker’s bars, cut in small pieces
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Serve cooled.
recipes.notes: Substitutions: For those with peanut allergies, use Milky Way bars.

recipes.title: Sloppy Joe Casserole
recipes.creator: Barb S.
instructions: Cook macaroni according to box instructions.
Prepare Sloppy Joe mix with beef, tomato paste, tomato sauce, and 1/4 cup of water.
Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a 2 1/2 qt. casserole dish, layer half the macaroni, half the cottage cheese, and half the meat mixture. Repeat.
Cover with cheddar cheese.
Bake uncovered for 40–50 minutes or until bubbly.
recipes.notes: Makes 6 servings. Substitutions: Any cheese on hand if no cheddar available.

recipes.title: Hot Tuna and Egg Buns
recipes.creator: Barb S.
ingredients: 1/3 cup mayonnaise or cooked salad dressing
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a medium bowl, mix tuna, olives, cheese, eggs, mayonnaise, relish, onion, and salt. Mix well.
Spoon into rolls and wrap each in foil.
Place on a cookie sheet.
Bake for 10 minutes.
Serve hot and in foil.
recipes.notes: Makes 8 servings.

recipes.title: Tossed Salad
recipes.creator: Bea S.
instructions: Layer lettuce, green pepper, onion, and peas.
Mix sugar and mayonnaise (not salad dressing) and carefully spread on top.
Sprinkle with grated cheese and bacon bits.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.
recipes.notes: The salad is best served after being refrigerated overnight.

recipes.title: Darrin’s Favorite No Bake Cookies
recipes.creator: Bea S.
instructions: Bring milk, cocoa, sugar, and shortening to a rolling boil.
Add remaining ingredients.
Drop on wax paper or in a pan.
recipes.notes: Customize with optional ingredients as desired.

recipes.title: Gene’s Favorite Salted Peanut Cookies
recipes.creator: Bea S.
instructions: Cream shortening, sugar, and eggs.
Add vanilla, baking powder, soda, flour, nuts, and oatmeal. Mix well.
Add corn flakes.
Put on greased baking sheet.
Bake at 350°F for 8-10 minutes.
recipes.notes: Ensure cookies are golden brown before removing from oven.

recipes.title: Jim’s Favorite Applesauce Cake
recipes.creator: Bea S.
instructions: Cream butter and sugar.
Add remaining ingredients.
Bake at 350°F in a 9x13 pan until done.
recipes.notes: Check the cake for doneness before removing from oven.

recipes.title: Upside Down Cake
recipes.creator: Bea S.
instructions: Butter a 9x13 pan, add fruit and sugar them.
Cover with dough.
Bake at 350°F for 35-40 minutes, ensuring fruit is soft.
Serve with cream or ice cream.
recipes.notes: Make sure fruit is soft before serving. Serving suggestion: with cream or ice cream.

recipes.title: Powdered Sugar Frosting
recipes.creator: Bea S.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Use enough of each to cover the entire goodie.
recipes.notes: Adjust the consistency as needed for spreading.

recipes.title: Apple Bars
recipes.creator: Bea S.
ingredients: Filling: 3-4 sliced apples, 1 ½ cup sugar, 2 tsp cinnamon, pinch of nutmeg
Crust: 2 ½ cup flour, 2 TBLS sugar, 1 cup shortening, milk, 2 egg yolks, 2 egg whites
instructions: Mix filling ingredients together and let stand.
For crust, mix dry ingredients and shortening.
Beat egg yolks and add enough milk to make 3/4 cup. Mix wet and dry ingredients and divide.
Roll out half of crust mixture and press into a 12x10 pan.
Crush 1 cup of corn flakes and place on top of crust.
Add filling, cover with remaining crust.
Beat 2 egg whites and spread over crust.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
Drizzle with powdered sugar frosting.
recipes.notes: Check for doneness before removing from oven. Drizzle with powdered sugar frosting while warm.

recipes.title: Gary’s Favorite Chocolate Date Bars
recipes.creator: Bea S.
instructions: Cook dates, sugar, and butter until dates are soft.
Remove from heat, stir in chocolate chips, flour, milk, soda, and eggs.
Place in a 9x13 pan and bake at 350°F for 25 minutes.
recipes.notes: Frosting: Boil 1 ½ cup sugar, 6 TBLS butter/margarine, and 6 TBLS milk for 1 min. Stir in ½ cup chocolate chips and spread over warm bars.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Pie
recipes.creator: Bea S.
instructions: Mix all ingredients and pour into pie crust.
Bake at 425°-450°F for 10 minutes.
Reduce heat to 350°F and bake for an additional 50 minutes.
If made in a 9x13 pan, double the recipe and bake for 60 minutes at 350°F.
recipes.notes: Adjust baking times based on the size of the pan used.

recipes.title: Snow Balls
recipes.creator: Bea S.
instructions: Cream butter and powdered sugar, add flour, and vanilla.
Mix well. Add nuts and water.
Bake at 250°F for 1 hour.
While hot, roll in powdered sugar.
recipes.notes: Makes approximately 50 balls.

recipes.title: Cinnamon Rhubarb Muffins
recipes.creator: Bonnie S.
instructions: In a bowl, combine flour, ½ cup sugar, baking powder, 1 tsp cinnamon, and salt.
Combine egg, buttermilk, and butter; stir into dry ingredients until moist.
Spoon 1 TBLS of batter into greased pan or lined muffin tin.
Combine rhubarb, and preserves and place 1 TBLS in the center of each cup.
Top with remaining batter.
Combine sugar and cinnamon, sprinkle over batter.
Bake at 400°F for 20 minutes or until the top of the muffin springs back when lightly touched.
recipes.notes: The rhubarb and peach preserves add a unique flavor to these muffins.

recipes.title: Lunchbox 'Handwiches'
recipes.creator: Bonnie S.
ingredients: ½ cup finely chopped and cooked ham
instructions: Allow dough to rise according to package directions.
Punch down and divide into 10 equal pieces.
Roll each piece into a circle about 5 inches.
Place ¼ cup ham and 2 TBLS cheese on each circle, press to flatten.
Beat egg yolk and water, brush on edges of circles.
Fold into semi-circles and pinch edges closed.
Brush tops with egg mixture and place on greased baking sheet.
Bake at 375°F for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.
Can be frozen and reheated in the microwave oven.
recipes.notes: Great for a quick lunch or snack, freezable for future use.

recipes.title: Blue Ribbon Bars
recipes.creator: Bonnie S.
instructions: Mix oatmeal, brown sugar, salt, 2/3 cup butter, vanilla, and syrup in a bowl.
Bake in a greased 9x13 pan at 350°F for 15 minutes. It will look raw.
Frost with a mixture of chocolate chips and remaining butter.
recipes.notes: The bars have a soft and chewy texture with a rich chocolate flavor.

recipes.title: No Bake Cookies
recipes.creator: Bonnie S.
instructions: Boil milk, cocoa, sugar, shortening, and salt.
Add oatmeal and other optional ingredients as desired.
Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper or put in a greased cake pan.
Cookies will set up in minutes.
recipes.notes: These cookies are quick and easy to make, with options for customization.

recipes.title: Tom’s Favorite Cowboy Cookies
recipes.creator: Bonnie S.
instructions: Sift flour, soda, salt, and baking powder together and set aside.
Cream shortening and sugars, then add eggs.
Add flour mixture to creamed mixture.
Add oatmeal, vanilla, and chocolate chips.
Drop by spoonful on cookie sheet and bake at 350°F for 15 minutes.
recipes.notes: Perfect for those who love a classic cookie with a twist.

recipes.title: Crazy Cake
recipes.creator: Bonnie S.
instructions: Put dry ingredients into a 9x13 pan.
Make 3 'wells'. Add oil, vanilla, and vinegar in 'wells'.
Pour water over all and stir together with a fork until well mixed.
Bake at 350°F for 30-40 minutes.
recipes.notes: Frosting: Mix 3 TBLS flour, ¾ cup sugar, ¾ cup milk, 1 tsp vanilla, and ¾ cup butter to make a smooth and creamy frosting.

recipes.title: Dutch Apple Pie
recipes.creator: Bonnie S.
ingredients: Crust: 2 cups flour, 1 cup packed brown sugar, ¾ cup butter, melted, ½ cup quick cooking oats
Filling: 2/3 cup sugar, 3 TBLS cornstarch, 1 ¼ cup water, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 3 cups diced, peeled, tart apples
instructions: Mix crust ingredients until crumbly, set aside 1 cup for topping.
Press remaining mixture in an ungreased 9-inch pie plate.
For filling, combine sugar, cornstarch, and water in a saucepan. Cook and stir until thickened.
Remove from heat, stir in apples and vanilla. Pour onto crust.
Top with reserved crumb mixture.
Bake at 350°F for 40-45 minutes or until crust is golden brown.
recipes.notes: The crumbly crust and tart apple filling make this a delightful dessert.

recipes.title: Lemony Chicken Fruit Salad
recipes.creator: Bonnie S.
instructions: Drain pineapple, reserving the juice. Set aside pineapple and 1/2 cup juice.
Toss remaining juice with apples and drain.
In a large bowl, combine chicken, grapes, pineapple, and apples. Refrigerate.
In a saucepan, melt butter. Stir in flour, sugar, and salt until smooth, gradually adding lemon juice and reserved pineapple juice.
Bring to a boil, cook for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Reduce heat, add a small amount to egg yolks, return to pan. Cook for 2 more minutes.
Remove from heat and chill for 10-15 minutes.
Beat cream until stiff peaks form, then fold into cooled dressing.
Pour over chicken mixture, gently stirring to coat.
Chill for 1 hour, serve in a lettuce-lined bowl.
Sprinkle with almonds.
recipes.notes: A refreshing salad with a lemony twist, perfect for summer days.

recipes.title: Campfire Potatoes
recipes.creator: Bonnie S.
ingredients: Salt and pepper to taste, or season salt
instructions: Place potatoes and onion on a large piece of heavy-duty foil.
Dot with butter.
Combine Worcestershire sauce, cheese, parsley, salt, and pepper. Sprinkle on potatoes.
Fold foil around potatoes and add broth. Seal the edges tightly.
Grill, covered, over medium heat for 35-40 minutes or until potatoes are tender.
recipes.notes: Great for outdoor cooking and camping trips.

recipes.title: Fluffy Dressing
recipes.creator: Bonnie S.
instructions: Place bread cubes in a large roasting pan or bowl.
In a saucepan, cook butter and onions until onions turn yellow.
Add seasonings and celery to bread.
Blend with a large fork.
Add butter and onions. Mix lightly.
Add hot water slowly, toss with a fork.
Cover and let stand until cool, can be for an hour or overnight.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour or stuff into turkey just before baking.
recipes.notes: Substitutions: 2 tsp celery salt can be used instead of actual celery.

recipes.title: Instant Stuffing Mix
recipes.creator: Bonnie S.
ingredients: 3 ½ cups unseasoned toasted bread cubes
instructions: Place bread cubes in a jar or resealable plastic bag.
In a small bag, mix celery flakes, parsley flakes, onion, bouillon, poultry seasoning, and sage well.
To prepare stuffing, bring water, butter, and contents of seasoning bag to a boil over medium heat.
Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat, add bread cubes and mix gently.
Cover and let stand for 5 minutes.
Toss with a fork just before serving.
recipes.notes: A convenient and quick way to prepare stuffing, perfect for saving time.

recipes.title: Frito Bean Delight
recipes.creator: Bonnie S.
ingredients: 1 can of Bush Baked Beans with onions
instructions: Stir hamburger, tomato soup, and baked beans together.
Warm in a large saucepan for about 10 minutes or until hot.
Serve with Frito Lay Chips on top.
recipes.notes: A hearty and satisfying dish, great for a quick and easy meal.

recipes.title: Dumplings
recipes.creator: Bonnie S.
instructions: Drop by spoonful into boiling hot water with a teaspoon of salt.
Boil for 5 minutes and lightly stir them to lift them off the bottom of the cooker.
Cover and cook for 5 more minutes.
Drain water.
Serve with gravy or sauerkraut.
recipes.notes: These dumplings are a versatile addition to any meal, especially comforting during colder seasons.

recipes.title: Lasagna Shells
recipes.creator: Bonnie S.
instructions: Brown and drain hamburger, add mushrooms, eggs, crackers, seasoning, ½ cup ragu sauce, and cheese in a medium bowl.
Cook shells according to package directions.
Fill shells with meat mixture and set in a 9x13 pan.
Pour remaining sauce over shells.
Cover with foil and bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
recipes.notes: A delicious twist on traditional lasagna, using jumbo shells stuffed with a flavorful meat mixture.

recipes.title: Mexican Chicken
recipes.creator: Bonnie S.
instructions: Cook and debone chicken. Cut tortillas into 1-inch strips and lay half in the bottom of a 9x13 baking dish.
Layer half of the chicken. In a bowl, combine soups, sour cream, milk, onion, salsa, salt, and pepper.
Pour half of the soup mixture on the chicken and then half of the cheeses.
Repeat layering with tortillas, chicken, soup mixture, and cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
recipes.notes: A hearty and flavorful dish with layers of tortillas, chicken, and cheese, perfect for a family meal.

recipes.title: Peachy Porkchops
recipes.creator: Bonnie S.
ingredients: 8 oz canned peaches, drained and diced
instructions: In a skillet, sauté onion and celery in butter until tender; transfer to a large bowl.
Add bread crumbs, poultry seasoning, sage, and pepper. Fold in peaches.
Combine eggs, water, and parsley; add to bread mixture. Toss gently.
Cut a large pocket in each pork chop; spoon stuffing loosely into pocket.
Brush chops with oil, sprinkle with garlic salt and pepper.
Brown chops on both sides in a skillet.
Place remaining stuffing in a greased 9x13 pan. Arrange chops over stuffing and spread preserves over chops.
Cover and bake at 350°F for 45 minutes, then uncover and bake for an additional 15 minutes or until juices run clear.
recipes.notes: A delightful combination of savory pork and sweet peach flavors, perfect for a special occasion.

recipes.title: Apple Crisp
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Mix first four ingredients together.
Put apple filling in cake pan with oatmeal mixture.
Bake at 350°F until apples are cooked.

recipes.title: Ice Cream Dessert
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Cut ice cream into ¾ inch squares.
Pat Oreos into 9x13 pan, reserve some Oreos for the top.
Lay ice cream over top of Oreos.
Pour caramel fudge over ice cream.
Spread Cool Whip over top and sprinkle with reserved Oreos.
Freeze until solid.
To serve, let sit out for 5 minutes at room temperature, then cut and serve.

recipes.title: Raspberry Pretzel Dessert
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Mix pretzels, sugar, and butter. Press into bottom and sides of 9x13 pan.
Bake for 15 minutes at 350°F. Set aside and cool.
Cream softened cream cheese, add sugar, beat well, and fold in marshmallows.
Spread over cooled crust.
Dissolve Jello in water and add berries.
Chill until slightly thickened.
Spread over cream cheese mixture and chill until served.

recipes.title: Brownies
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Cream butter and sugar.
Add remaining ingredients and mix well.
Bake in bar pan (9x13) at 350°F until toothpick comes out clean.

recipes.title: German Chocolate Caramel Brownies
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Melt caramels and 1/3 cup milk.
Mix remaining ingredients.
Pat 2/3 of cake mixture into 9x13 pan.
Bake at 350°F for 8 minutes.
Sprinkle 1 cup chocolate chips.
Pour on caramel mixture and drop the remaining cake batter on top.
Bake an additional 18 minutes.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Bars
recipes.creator: Colette S.
ingredients: Frosting ingredients: 3 oz cream cheese, ¾ stick butter, 2 TBLS milk, 1 tsp vanilla, 1 ¾ cup powdered sugar
instructions: Combine all ingredients and mix well.
Pour into 9x13 pan and bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
For frosting, mix all frosting ingredients and frost cooled bars.

recipes.title: Banana Cake
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Mix all ingredients.
Spread into a 9x13 pan.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Better Than Sex Cake
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Make cake according to directions on box and cool.
Poke holes in cake.
Mix milk and topping, pour over cake to fill in holes.
Top with Cool Whip and crushed candy bars.
Chill.

recipes.title: Caramel Apple Cheesecake
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Reserve ¾ cup pie filling, spoon remaining filling into crust.
Beat cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla until smooth.
Add eggs and beat well.
Pour over pie filling in crust and bake for 35 minutes or until set.
Cool.
Mix caramel and reserved pie filling in a saucepan and heat for 1 minute.
Spoon caramel onto cheesecake and spread evenly.
Sprinkle pecans over caramel.
Refrigerate until ready to serve.

recipes.title: Chewy Choc-oat-chip Cookies
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Heat oven to 375°F.
Beat butter and sugars together until creamy.
Add eggs, milk, and vanilla; mix well.
Add combined flour, baking soda, and salt.
Stir in oatmeal, chocolate chips, and nuts.
Drop by spoonfuls onto cookie sheet.
Bake for 10 minutes.

recipes.title: Monster Cookies
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a bowl, mix together flour, oatmeal, and baking soda.
In a large bowl, cream sugars and butter, add eggs and mix until well blended.
Stir in dry ingredients, chocolate chips, and M&M’s.
Drop by spoonfuls onto cookie sheet.
Bake for 8-10 minutes.

recipes.title: No Bake Cookies
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Mix milk, cocoa, sugar, and butter together in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil.
Add oatmeal and peanut butter.
Drop on wax paper and let cool.

recipes.title: Baking Powder Biscuits
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Mix dry ingredients together.
Slowly work in wet ingredients.
Drop by spoonfuls onto a cookie sheet.
Bake at 450°F for 12-15 minutes.

recipes.title: Garlic Cheese Bread
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Heat oven to 375°F. Spray cookie sheet.
Place dough on sheet, do not unroll.
Starting at center, press out dough.
Sprinkle cheese over dough.
Bring long sides up over the cheese and pinch closed.
Sprinkle with garlic powder.
Bake for 15-20 minutes.

recipes.title: Zucchini Bread
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together well.
Bake at 325°F for 1 hour.

recipes.title: Caramel Snack Mix
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a small sprayed roasting pan, combine cereal, pretzels, and peanuts.
In a saucepan, combine sugar, butter, and corn syrup. Heat to boiling and let boil for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and add vanilla.
Pour over cereal. Toss to coat.
Bake for 20 minutes, stirring halfway through.
Cool on wax paper. Break into small clusters.

recipes.title: Cream Cheese Pie Crust
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Combine first four ingredients in a bowl; beat well at medium speed, until smooth.
Add milk and egg yolk and beat until well blended.
Lightly spoon flour into a dry measuring cup; level with a knife.
Add flour, baking powder, and salt to bowl; stirring until blended.
Press mixture gently into a 4-inch circle on plastic wrap.
Chill for 5 minutes.
Roll dough (still covered) into an 11-inch circle.
Place into pie plate.
Fill with desired filling.

recipes.title: Dessert Nachos
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Break graham crackers in half, mark a diagonal line on each half with a knife, and break apart to make triangles.
Place half of the triangles in a single layer on a serving plate.
Spread half of Cool Whip on crackers evenly, then top with half of the fruit.
Drizzle with topping.
Repeat layers.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Double Caramel Munchin Mix
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Microwave butter and topping for 1 minute on high.
Pour cereal, popcorn, and peanuts into a resealable plastic bag.
Pour topping mixture over cereal.
Seal bag and shake until all pieces are evenly coated.
Pour contents into a large microwave-safe bowl and cook for 5 minutes, stirring every minute.
Spread on wax paper to cool.

recipes.title: Festive Cheese Ball
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Beat cheeses together with a mixer until creamy.
Blend in sesame seeds and sauce.
Form into a ball shape.
Chill for several hours.
Just before serving, roll in chopped nuts (optional).

recipes.title: Hidden Valley Ranch Oyster Crackers
recipes.creator: Colette S.
ingredients: 1 package Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix
instructions: Preheat oven to 250°F.
Combine salad oil with dill weed and ranch packet.
Pour over crackers and stir to coat.
Place in oven for 15-20 minutes, stirring halfway through.

recipes.title: Jell-o Pinwheels
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Lightly spray a 9-inch pan with cooking spray.
Mix Jell-o and water in a microwave-safe bowl. Stir for 1 ½ minutes to dissolve.
Add marshmallows to gelatin. Microwave for 1 minute until melted.
Stir until completely melted and mixture is smooth.
Creamy layer will float to the top.
Pour into the pan and refrigerate for 45 minutes until set.
Loosen edges with a knife dipped in water.
Starting at one end, roll tightly. Cut into 10-12 pieces and serve.

recipes.title: Nuts & Bolts
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Spread wheat in a cake pan, cover with melted butter and sprinkle with garlic powder.
Bake at 350°F for 15 minutes.
Add the rest of the ingredients and stir.

recipes.title: Peanut Clusters
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Melt butter, marshmallows, and chocolate chips together.
Stir in Rice Krispies and peanuts.
Drop on wax paper and let cool.

recipes.title: Puppy Chow
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Melt butter, peanut butter, and chocolate chips together.
Add sugar and cereal.
Stir to evenly coat and let cool.

recipes.title: Sausage Cheese Ball
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Mix all ingredients together and form 1-inch balls.
Bake for 15 minutes on a cookie sheet.

recipes.title: Quarterback Scramble
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Melt butter in a bar pan in the oven.
Stir in seasoning packet.
Add cereal and nuts. Mix well until all pieces are coated.
Bake for 45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes.
Add beef jerky and cheese. Stir to coat evenly.
Bake an additional 15 minutes.
Let cool and enjoy.

recipes.title: Spinach Dip
recipes.creator: Colette S.
ingredients: 1 package (10oz) frozen spinach, thawed and drained
instructions: Blend all ingredients and simmer for 10 minutes.

recipes.title: Sticks and Stones
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Heat oven to 300°F.
Mix the cereal and pretzels in a bar pan.
Stir butter and Worcestershire sauce in a small bowl.
Pour over cereal mixture; stir until mixture is evenly coated.
Bake for 25 minutes, stirring every 3 minutes.
Add raisins and let cool.

recipes.title: Taco Dip
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Brown and drain hamburger.
Mix in taco seasoning, tomatoes, and cornstarch.
Add cheese, cut into chunks.
Put in a crock pot and stir periodically.
Ready to eat when cheese is melted.
Serve with chips.

recipes.title: Veggie Pizza
recipes.creator: Colette S.
ingredients: 1 package Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix
instructions: Roll out crescents in a rectangular form. Press all seams together.
Bake according to package directions.
In a food processor, mix cream cheese, ranch mix, and mayo.
Cut vegetables into small pieces and mix into cheese mixture.
Spread onto crust and sprinkle shredded cheese on top.

recipes.title: Vodka Slush
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Heat sugar and water until sugar is dissolved.
Add frozen juices and vodka. Mix well.
Place in freezer container and freeze.
Serve with ½ glass slush and ½ glass 7-up or orange soda.

recipes.title: Zesty Party Crunch
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Heat oven to 325°F.
Melt butter in a 9x13 pan, stir in cheese and seasoning.
Add cereal and peanuts, stir until coated well.
Bake about 20 minutes, stirring every 4 minutes.
Cool and enjoy.

recipes.title: BBQ Sauce
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together and simmer for 10 minutes.

recipes.title: Biscuits and Gravy
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Bake biscuits as directed on package.
Brown sausage and drain.
Melt butter; add flour, sausage, and milk.
Gravy will thicken as milk gets hot.

recipes.title: Ciji’s Potatoes
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Cut up potatoes in baking dish.
Mix remaining ingredients and add to potatoes.
Bake at 375°F for 1 hour or until potatoes are done.

recipes.title: Cody’s Spaghetti
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Brown and drain hamburger.
Cook noodles and drain.
Mix all ingredients together and heat through.

recipes.title: Creamy 2 Cheese Potatoes Au Gratin
recipes.creator: Colette S.
ingredients: 1 ¼ cup hot cheddar cheese sauce
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Place the potatoes and garlic cloves in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil and cook for 8 minutes, then drain.
Combine the cheese sauce, salt, and pepper.
Arrange half of the potatoes and garlic in a 2-quart baking dish sprayed with cooking spray.
Pour half of sauce mixture over potatoes and repeat.
Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and paprika.
Bake for 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Dumplings
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Drop by the spoonful into a pot of boiling water and cook until they float, about 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Easy Stromboli
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Unroll dough and place on a cookie sheet. Press dough into a 12x8 rectangle.
Spread sauce over dough within 2 inches of long edge.
Top with ham, cheese, peppers, and seasoning.
Fold long sides over filling and pinch to seal.
Bake at 400°F for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

recipes.title: Hidden Valley Ranch Pinwheels
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Mix cream cheese, ranch packet, and onion together.
Spread on tortillas.
Drain vegetables and blot dry on paper towels.
Sprinkle equal amounts of remaining ingredients on top of cream cheese.
Roll tortillas tightly.
Chill at least 2 hours.
Cut rolls into 1-inch pieces and discard ends.
Serve with spirals facing up. Dip in desired salsa.

recipes.title: Lasagna Hotdish
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Brown hamburger and drain.
Cook noodles and drain.
Layer hamburger, cream of mushroom soup, tomato soup, and noodles in a casserole dish.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes, then add cheese and bake an additional 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Levi’s Favorite Breakfast
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Brown hash browns.
Add eggs and scramble until eggs are done.
Add little smokies and cheese.
Heat until cheese is melted.

recipes.title: Meatloaf
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Mix hamburger, crackers, onion, egg, salt, and pepper in a loaf pan.
Top with ketchup and BBQ sauce.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.

recipes.title: No Measure BBQ’s
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Brown hamburger and drain.
Add rest of the ingredients and heat through.

recipes.title: Pizza Burgers
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Brown hamburger and drain.
Add rest of the ingredients.
Place on a bun.
Put under broiler until hot.

recipes.title: Pizza Hotdish
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Brown hamburger and drain.
Cook noodles and drain.
Add remaining ingredients.
Heat through.
For additional options, add whatever your favorite pizza ingredients are.

recipes.title: Pork Sausage Hotdish
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Brown hamburger and pork. Do not drain.
Cook noodles according to package directions.
Mix meats, soup, corn, and macaroni.
Place in casserole dish and bake at 350°F for 1 hour.

recipes.title: Sesame Chicken with Dipping Sauce
recipes.creator: Colette S.
ingredients: Dipping Sauce ingredients: 1 cup red currant jelly, 4 tsp soy sauce, 2 tsp ginger
instructions: Heat oven to 350°F. Spray pan with cooking spray.
Combine chicken and teriyaki sauce in a bowl. Let stand for 15 minutes.
Combine flour, salt, and pepper in a resealable bag.
Lightly beat egg whites.
Spread out sesame seeds in a shallow pan.
Add chicken to flour mixture. Shake to coat.
Dip floured chicken pieces in egg whites and then roll in sesame seeds.
Place on baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.
For the dipping sauce, combine ingredients in a small saucepan and heat gently to warm. Serve with chicken.

recipes.title: Sauerkraut Hotdish
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Brown and drain hamburger.
Cook noodles according to package directions and drain.
Add remaining ingredients and heat through.

recipes.title: Smashed Potatoes
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Cook potatoes and drain.
Smash potatoes; add cream cheese, butter, and milk.
Stir. Can be made ahead of time and warmed in the oven.

recipes.title: Swiss Vegetable Medley
recipes.creator: Colette S.
ingredients: 1 bag (16oz) California blend vegetables, thawed and drained
instructions: Combine vegetables, soup, ½ cup cheese, sour cream, pepper, pimento, and ½ can fried onions.
Pour into a casserole dish, cover, and bake at 350°F for 30 minutes or until vegetables are done.
Sprinkle remaining cheese and fried onions on top.
Bake an additional 5 minutes uncovered.

recipes.title: Taco Hotdish
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: In a cake pan, layer chips.
Mix hamburger, taco seasoning, cheese soup, and milk. Pour over the top of chips.
Add shredded lettuce over meat mixture and top with cheese.
Bake at 350°F until cheese melts.
Top with favorite taco toppings.

recipes.title: Tuna Melts
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Drain tuna.
Mix all ingredients together and place on bread.
Put a slice of cheese on top and put under broiler until cheese melts.

recipes.title: Turkey Salad Tortillas
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Combine turkey, cheese, celery, onion, olives, mayo, picante sauce, and salt. Mix well.
Spoon ½ cup filling in center of each tortilla. Fold like a burrito.
Place in shallow microwave-safe dish. Cover and microwave on high for 2-3 minutes until cheese melts and filling is hot.
Alternatively, heat in a frying pan until sides are golden.

recipes.title: Waffles/Pancakes
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together until batter is smooth.
Drop by the spoonful into a frying pan.
Turn batter when bubbles are on top.

recipes.title: Wild Rice Hotdish
recipes.creator: Colette S.
instructions: Mix everything but the cheese together.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes covered.
Add cheese and bake an additional 30 minutes uncovered.

recipes.title: Salmon Cheese Spread
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
ingredients: 1 can salmon, drained, boned, and skinned
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, mayo, and lemon juice.
Add salt, curry powder, basil, and pepper; mix well.
Gently stir in salmon and onions.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Serve with crackers.
recipes.notes: Yield: 1-1 ½ cups. Dorene usually adds a little horseradish to the recipe.

recipes.title: Sugar Cookies
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
ingredients: Decorative sugar, candy decorettes, gumdrops, or crushed hard peppermint candy (optional)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Thoroughly cream shortening, sugar, and vanilla.
Add egg; beat till light and fluffy.
Stir in milk.
Sift together dry ingredients; blend into creamed mixture.
Divide dough in half; chill 1 hour.
On lightly floured surface, roll dough to 1/8 inch thickness.
Cut in desired shapes with cutters.
Bake on greased cookie sheet at 375 degrees for about 6 to 8 minutes.
Cool slightly; remove from pan.
recipes.notes: Yield: 2 dozen cookies. Optional cookie trims can be applied before baking.

recipes.title: White Sauce
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
ingredients: 2 to 3 TBLS butter (quantity varies for sauce thickness)
1 to 4 TBLS flour (quantity varies for sauce thickness)
1 to 1 ½ cups milk (quantity varies for sauce thickness)
instructions: Melt butter in saucepan over low heat.
Blend in flour, salt, and a dash of white pepper.
Add milk all at once.
Cook quickly, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and bubbles.
recipes.notes: Yield: 1 to 1 ½ cups, depending on desired thickness (medium, thick, or thin).

recipes.title: Vegetable Relish
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
instructions: Cover the ground vegetables with pickling salt and let stand overnight.
Rinse off all salt and drain.
Combine sugar, cider vinegar, water, mustard seeds, celery seeds, and turmeric with vegetables; bring to a boil.
Leave ½ inch headspace when filling jars.
Boil for 30 minutes then pack and seal jars.
recipes.notes: The recipe is for canning vegetable relish. Ensure proper canning techniques are followed for safety.

recipes.title: Seven Layer Magic Cookie Bars
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
ingredients: 1 14oz. can Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk (not evaporated milk)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350° (325° for glass dish).
In a 13 x 9 inch baking pan, melt butter in oven.
Sprinkle crumbs over butter; pour milk evenly on top of crumbs.
Top with remaining ingredients in order listed; press down firmly with a fork.
Bake for 25 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool and cut into bars.
recipes.notes: Yield: 24 to 36 bars.

recipes.title: Shrimp Casserole
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
ingredients: 2 lb. cooked shrimp (medium size, cut in 4 pieces)
instructions: Sauté onions and parsley in butter.
Add soup, mushrooms and cheese; mix well until cheese is melted.
Pour over macaroni and shrimp; mix well.
Pour all ingredients into greased casserole.
Top with bread crumbs and bake at 375° for 30 to 40 min or until golden brown.
recipes.notes: Makes 8 to 10 servings.

recipes.title: Christmas Pudding
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
instructions: Boil prunes, raisins, apples, and currents separately.
When boiled, combine all in one kettle.
Add vinegar and sugar.
Brown the flour before adding it to the mixture, then boil until thickened.
Add chopped walnuts.
Keep in a cool place.
recipes.notes: Store in a cool place.

recipes.title: Zucchini Bread
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
instructions: Stir together all ingredients.
Put in 2 bread size loaf pans.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan.
recipes.notes: Yield: 2 loaves.

recipes.title: Chili Dip
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
ingredients: Sliced Monterey Jack Cheese with jalapeno peppers
instructions: Spread softened cream cheese in an 8x8 or 9x9 microwavable pan.
Spread can of chili over, add thinly sliced Monterey Jack cheese.
Microwave on high for 2 minutes. Turn ¼ turn and microwave 30 seconds.
Repeat last step until cheese melts, no longer than 4 minutes.
Serve with corn chips.
recipes.notes: Adjust microwave times as needed.

recipes.title: Eggnog
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
instructions: Combine eggs, milk, and sugar in double boiler. Cook on low heat until it forms a smooth custard, about 30 min.
Cool.
Beat in cream, rum until smooth.
Chill.
Flavor with nutmeg or cinnamon if desired.
Sprinkle nutmeg on top before serving.
recipes.notes: Cooking time: 30 min. Chill before serving.

recipes.title: Granola Fudge Clusters
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
ingredients: 1 ¼ cup granola cereal without raisins
instructions: In a microwave-safe bowl, melt the chocolate and butterscotch chips; stir until smooth.
Stir in granola cereal and walnuts.
Drop by tablespoonfuls onto wax paper-lined baking sheets.
Refrigerate for 15 minutes or until firm.
recipes.notes: Makes about 2 ½ dozen.

recipes.title: Cranberry & Caramel Date Bars
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
ingredients: ½ cup packed light brown sugar
instructions: Heat oven to 350°.
In a bowl, combine cranberries and 2 tablespoons sugar.
In another bowl, combine 2 cups flour, oats, remaining ½ cup sugar, brown sugar, and soda. Add margarine; mix well.
Reserve 1 cup crumb mixture; press remainder firmly on bottom of 13 x 9 baking pan. Bake 15 minutes.
Sprinkle dates, walnuts, and cranberry mixture over crust.
Mix caramel topping and remaining 1/3 cup flour; spoon over fruit and walnuts.
Top with reserved crumb mixture. Bake 20 minutes or until lightly brown.
Cool. Cut into 24 bars.
recipes.notes: Preparation time: 35 min. Yield: 24 bars.

recipes.title: Shrimp Creole
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
instructions: Wash and de-vein shrimp. Keep in refrigerator until ready to use.
Sauté garlic, onion, and pepper in oil.
Add sautéed vegetables to tomato sauce and paste. Simmer 15 to 20 minutes.
Add shrimp and cook until all turns pink (approximately 10 minutes).
Season with salt and pepper. A pinch of red pepper can be used.
Serve over long grain rice.
recipes.notes: Season with a pinch of red pepper for extra spice.

recipes.title: Chicken Tacos
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
instructions: Tear chicken into bite-size strips (about 3 cups).
Heat oven to 350°. Have baking sheet ready.
Place chicken, taco seasoning, and water in a large skillet. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer until seasoned water evaporates, about 10 minutes.
Stir in taco sauce and heat through.
Separate taco shells and arrange on baking sheet. Bake 5 to 7 minutes until warm and crisp.
Spoon about 3 tablespoons chicken mixture into each shell.
Top with 2 tablespoons shredded lettuce and 1 tablespoon each of cheese and tomato.
recipes.notes: Serves 3-4. Baking time: 5-7 min.

recipes.title: Quick and Easy Seafood Quiche
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
ingredients: ¾ lb imitation seafood or 2 cans of shrimp, drained
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Gently sauté onions and garlic in 1 tablespoon butter; set aside.
Mix Bisquick, water, and milk to pie crust consistency. Cover and set aside in a warm place.
Beat 2 eggs and 2 egg yolks thoroughly. Add cheeses and stir in by hand.
Add onions, seafood, and broccoli.
Press Bisquick mix into 2 lightly oiled pie plates and up the sides.
Beat 2 egg whites until fluffy, but not stiff. Fold into egg and cheese mixture.
Pour egg mixture evenly into pies. Scatter chopped scallions on top.
Bake 45 to 60 minutes until center is set.
Cool 5 minutes before cutting.
recipes.notes: Yield: 2 pies. Cooking time: 45-60 min.

recipes.title: Granola Fudge Clusters
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
ingredients: 1 ¼ cup granola cereal without raisins
instructions: In a microwave-safe bowl, melt the chocolate and butterscotch chips; stir until smooth.
Stir in granola cereal and walnuts.
Drop by tablespoonfuls onto wax paper-lined baking sheets.
Refrigerate for 15 minutes or until firm.
recipes.notes: Makes about 2 ½ dozen.

recipes.creator: Dorene M.

instructions: Heat oven to 350°.
In a bowl, combine cranberries and 2 tablespoons sugar.
In another bowl, combine 2 cups flour, oats, remaining ½ cup sugar, brown sugar, and soda. Add margarine; mix well.
Reserve 1 cup crumb mixture; press remainder firmly on bottom of 13 x 9 baking pan. Bake 15 minutes.
Sprinkle dates, walnuts, and cranberry mixture over crust.
Mix caramel topping and remaining 1/3 cup flour; spoon over fruit and walnuts.
Top with reserved crumb mixture. Bake 20 minutes or until lightly brown.
Cool. Cut into 24 bars.
recipes.notes: Preparation time: 35 min. Yield: 24 bars.

recipes.title: Shrimp Creole
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
instructions: Wash and de-vein shrimp. Keep in refrigerator until ready to use.
Sauté garlic, onion, and pepper in oil.
Add sautéed vegetables to tomato sauce and paste. Simmer 15 to 20 minutes.
Add shrimp and cook until all turns pink (approximately 10 minutes).
Season with salt and pepper. A pinch of red pepper can be used.
Serve over long grain rice.
recipes.notes: Season with a pinch of red pepper for extra spice.

recipes.title: Chicken Tacos
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
instructions: Tear chicken into bite-size strips (about 3 cups).
Heat oven to 350°. Have baking sheet ready.
Place chicken, taco seasoning, and water in a large skillet. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer until seasoned water evaporates, about 10 minutes.
Stir in taco sauce and heat through.
Separate taco shells and arrange on baking sheet. Bake 5 to 7 minutes until warm and crisp.
Spoon about 3 tablespoons chicken mixture into each shell.
Top with 2 tablespoons shredded lettuce and 1 tablespoon each of cheese and tomato.
recipes.notes: Serves 3-4. Baking time: 5-7 min.

recipes.title: Quick and Easy Seafood Quiche
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
ingredients: ¾ lb imitation seafood or 2 cans of shrimp, drained
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Gently sauté onions and garlic in 1 tablespoon butter; set aside.
Mix Bisquick, water, and milk to pie crust consistency. Cover and set aside in a warm place.
Beat 2 eggs and 2 egg yolks thoroughly. Add cheeses and stir in by hand.
Add onions, seafood, and broccoli.
Press Bisquick mix into 2 lightly oiled pie plates and up the sides.
Beat 2 egg whites until fluffy, but not stiff. Fold into egg and cheese mixture.
Pour egg mixture evenly into pies. Scatter chopped scallions on top.
Bake 45 to 60 minutes until center is set.
Cool 5 minutes before cutting.
recipes.notes: Yield: 2 pies. Cooking time: 45-60 min.

recipes.title: Reuben Casserole
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
ingredients: 2 4 oz pkg. sliced corned beef, shredded
2 cups (8 oz) pkg shredded Swiss cheese
instructions: Spread sauerkraut in the bottom of 12 x 8 inch baking dish.
Top with tomato slices, dot with dressing and butter.
Cover with corned beef, sprinkle with cheese.
Bake at 425° for 15 minutes.
Remove casserole from oven. Separate each biscuit into 3 layers; slightly overlap biscuit layers on casserole to form three rows.
Sprinkle with crackers and caraway seed.
Bake an additional 15 to 20 minutes, until biscuit topping is golden brown.
recipes.notes: Serves 6-8. Baking time: 30-35 min.

recipes.title: Favorite Turkey Scallops
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
instructions: Cook celery in water until tender.
Toast bread, cut in cubes and pour melted butter over.
Combine liquid from celery with enough milk and some chicken broth, if available, to make 2 cups liquid.
Make white sauce using butter, flour, and this liquid mixture.
Add seasonings to white sauce.
Layer in casserole dish; half of the bread cubes in first. Place celery and chicken on top.
Pour half white sauce over. Add remaining cubes and end with the rest of the white sauce.
Bake at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes.
recipes.notes: Serves 6-8. Baking time: 20-25 min.

recipes.title: Turkey or Chicken Casserole
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
ingredients: 1 4 oz. can mushroom stems and pieces
1 cup soup (mushroom, celery, or cream of chicken)
instructions: Combine meat, vegetables, and seasonings.
Blend soup and milk. Add to other ingredients and mix lightly.
Pour into greased 2-quart baking dish.
Arrange noodles in a ring around the edge.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
recipes.notes: Serves 6. Baking time: 45 min.

recipes.title: Seafood or Chicken Hot Dish
recipes.creator: Dorene M.
ingredients: ¼ cup green pepper and pimento (optional)
1 can chicken, tuna, crab, lobster, or shrimp
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Bake in a greased dish set in a pan of hot water for 1 hour in a slow oven, at 275°.
Then bake for 1 more hour at 350°. This allows the liquid to evaporate.
Garnish with hard-cooked eggs, optional.
recipes.notes: Makes 6-8 servings. Total cooking time: 2 hours.

recipes.title: Steven’s Chicken and Rice
recipes.creator: Janell B.
ingredients: 2 cans cream of mushroom or cream of chicken soup
instructions: Mix together all ingredients.
Bake at 325° for 1 hour.
recipes.notes: Simple and hearty one-dish meal.

recipes.title: Aaron’s Pizza Hotdish
recipes.creator: Janell B.
instructions: Brown hamburger with onions, salt, and pepper; drain.
Add soup, sauce, and water.
Cook noodles and drain.
Layer half the noodles in the bottom of a buttered 2 qt casserole; cover with all but 3 slices of cheese.
Top with half of the beef mixture; repeat with noodles and beef mixture.
Top with 3 cheese slices.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
recipes.notes: Serves 4-6. Hearty and filling.

recipes.title: Ranch Style Beans
recipes.creator: Janell B.
instructions: Brown hamburger. Season to taste.
In a pot, mix remaining ingredients together.
Put the browned hamburger into the pot.
Bake for 1 hour.
recipes.notes: Substitution: 1 can pork and beans for kidney beans if preferred.

recipes.title: Caramels
recipes.creator: Janell B.
instructions: Bring syrup, butter, sugar, and half the milk to a boil.
Add remaining milk and cook to soft-ball stage or 242°.
Remove from heat, add vanilla and walnuts.
Pour into buttered 9x13 pan.
Cool, cut, and wrap.
recipes.notes: Rich and indulgent homemade caramels.

recipes.title: Nut Goodies
recipes.creator: Janell B.
instructions: Melt together white almond bark, chocolate chips, peanut butter chips, and peanut butter. Pour half of the mixture into a buttered 9x13 pan. Chill well.
Melt caramels with water and butter, pour over chilled chocolate mixture. Chill well.
Mix salted peanuts into the rest of the chocolate mixture. Chill well.
recipes.notes: Delicious layered nutty and chocolate treat.

recipes.title: Buckeyes
recipes.creator: Janell B.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix sugar, peanut butter, butter, and vanilla. Mix well.
Roll into 1-inch balls. Refrigerate.
Melt chocolate chips in the microwave.
Dip balls into chocolate, covering only the top half.
Refrigerate.
recipes.notes: Refrigerate until firm. Classic peanut butter and chocolate treat.

recipes.title: Snicker’s Bars
recipes.creator: Janell B.
ingredients: 1 ½ cup chopped dry roasted peanuts
instructions: Melt the first layer ingredients over a double boiler and put in a buttered 9x13 pan.
Boil sugar, milk, and butter for 5 minutes for the second layer.
Add peanut butter, marshmallow crème, and vanilla. Pour over the first layer.
Spread chopped nuts over the top of the second layer.
Melt caramels and milk together and spread over nuts.
Melt together the ingredients for the fourth layer and mix. Spread on caramels.
Refrigerate after each layer. After cooled, cut into small pieces.
recipes.notes: Makes rich, multi-layered bars. Refrigerate between layers.

recipes.title: Salted Nut Rolls
recipes.creator: Janell B.
instructions: Knead together marshmallow crème and powdered sugar.
Shape into small fingers. Put fingers on a waxed cookie sheet and freeze.
Melt caramels and water in a double boiler.
Dip fingers into caramel mixture and roll in chopped nuts.
Freeze until set. Wrap each roll and refrigerate until served.
recipes.notes: Can be stored in the refrigerator. A sweet and salty treat.

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Cups
recipes.creator: Janell B.
instructions: Roll the first three ingredients into balls.
Melt chocolate bark and peanut butter in a double boiler.
Spoon enough chocolate mixture to cover the bottom of paper candy cups.
Add rolled ball. Spoon chocolate mixture over top.
Keep in refrigerator or freezer.
recipes.notes: Store in a cool place. Classic peanut butter and chocolate combo.

recipes.title: Chocolate Pretzel Ring
recipes.creator: Janell B.
instructions: Place pretzels on greased baking sheets, place a kiss in the center of each ring.
Bake at 275° for 2-3 minutes or until chocolate is soft.
Remove from oven. Place an M&M on each kiss. Press down until chocolate fills pretzel ring.
Refrigerate for 5 minutes or until chocolate is firm.
Store at room temperature.
recipes.notes: A sweet and salty snack. Easy to make and perfect for parties.

recipes.title: Chocolate Nut Fudge
recipes.creator: Janell B.
ingredients: 2 Squares (1 oz each) unsweetened chocolate, melted
instructions: Butter a 9x13 pan with 1 TBLS butter, set aside.
In a large saucepan, combine sugar, milk, and remaining butter. Bring to a full boil over medium heat.
Boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat, stir in marshmallows until melted.
Add chocolate chips, melted unsweetened chocolate, nuts, and vanilla. Stir until smooth.
Spread into buttered pan. Cool for 1 hour at room temperature, then cut into squares.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.
recipes.notes: Makes about 5 lbs. Rich and chocolatey fudge.

recipes.title: Veggie Pizza
recipes.creator: Joy P.
instructions: Mix cream cheese, mayo, and ranch packet together until it tastes good.
Layout croissants flat and pinch seams together to make the crust.
Bake according to package directions. Let cool.
After cooling, spread cream cheese mixture onto crust.
Top with chopped vegetables.
recipes.notes: Makes a 9x13 pan. Fresh and colorful veggie pizza, perfect as a snack or side dish.

recipes.title: Chicken Enchilada Soup
recipes.creator: KayLynn S.
instructions: Add 1 tsp of oil to a large pot, cook over medium heat. Brown chicken breast 4-5 min each side. Set chicken aside.
Add onions and garlic and sauté for 2 min over medium heat.
Add chicken broth.
Combine masa harina with 2 cups of water in a medium bowl and whisk until blended.
Add masa mixture with onions and broth.
Add remaining water, enchilada sauce, cheese, and spices.
Cook over medium heat until cheese is melted and soup is hot.
Garnish with crumbled tortilla chips, salsa, sour cream, or shredded cheese.
recipes.notes: Hearty and flavorful soup, perfect for a comforting meal.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Bars
recipes.creator: KayLynn S.
instructions: Add all main ingredients and bake at 350° for 30 min.
For frosting, combine powdered sugar, vanilla, sour cream, and margarine. Spread over cooled bars.
recipes.notes: Seasonal treat, great for fall and holidays.

recipes.title: Chili
recipes.creator: KayLynn S.
instructions: Brown hamburger and place in a large crock pot with all ingredients.
Simmer on low for a few hours.
Can also add mushrooms if desired.
recipes.notes: Rich and hearty chili, perfect for cold days. Simmering enhances flavors.

recipes.title: French Bread Pizza
recipes.creator: KayLynn S.
instructions: Cut French bread in half lengthwise.
Spread with pizza sauce.
Arrange desired toppings on sauce and sprinkle with cheese.
Bake at 400° for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.
recipes.notes: Customizable and quick, a great alternative to traditional pizza.

recipes.title: Daniel’s Favorite Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.creator: Kim S.
instructions: Mix ingredients in the order given.
Bake at 320° for 11 min.
recipes.notes: Soft and chewy cookies with a unique twist from vanilla pudding.

recipes.title: Pheasant or Chicken
recipes.creator: Kim S.
instructions: Wrap meat with one piece of beef, then one slice of bacon.
Place in bottom of greased 9x13 inch pan.
Mix soup and sour cream, spread over meat.
Bake at 275° for 3 ½ hours.
Can be prepared ahead of time and refrigerated overnight.
recipes.notes: Tender and flavorful, great for a comforting meal.

recipes.title: Taco Pie
recipes.creator: Kim S.
instructions: Mix Bisquick and half a cup of water to make crust.
Mix hamburger, taco seasoning, and a half a cup of water.
Layer 1 cup of the corn chips, hamburger mixture, sour cream, cheddar cheese, and the rest of the corn chips on top.
Bake at 375° for 20-25 min.
Serve with chopped lettuce, tomatoes, and black olives (optional) on top.
recipes.notes: A fun and tasty twist on classic tacos.

recipes.title: Snicker Salad
recipes.creator: Kim S.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Enjoy.
recipes.notes: A unique and easy dessert salad combining apples and Snickers.

recipes.title: Broccoli Cheese Soup
recipes.creator: Kim S.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Cook over low heat until hot.
recipes.notes: A creamy and comforting soup, perfect for cold days.

recipes.title: Old El Paso Easy Beef Enchiladas
recipes.creator: Kim S.
instructions: Brown and drain hamburger.
Mix in ¾ cup sauce and 1 cup cheese.
Spoon meat filling onto center of tortilla shell, roll and place in greased 9x13 inch pan.
Pour remaining enchilada sauce over top and sprinkle remaining cheese.
Bake at 375° for 15-20 min.
recipes.notes: Easy and delicious enchiladas, perfect for a quick dinner.

recipes.title: Baked Pork Chops
recipes.creator: Kim S.
instructions: Put chops in a roaster.
Place sliced onion on top of each chop (optional).
Combine remaining ingredients and pour over top.
Cover and bake at 350° for 1 ½ hours.
Optional - lay peeled potatoes around on top of meat, bake all together.
recipes.notes: Simple and savory pork chops, great for a hearty meal.

recipes.title: Ring Hotdish
recipes.creator: Kim S.
instructions: Brown hamburger and onion together.
Mix remaining ingredients and hamburger.
Top with bread crumbs and melted butter (mixed).
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
recipes.notes: Hearty and comforting casserole, great for family dinners.

recipes.title: Blueberry Crisp
recipes.creator: Nancy S.
instructions: Mix all ingredients except fruit in a mixer.
Place fruit in the bottom of an ungreased pan, and put crumbled mixer mixture on top of fruit.
Bake at 350° for 50 min or until crumbled mixture is light brown.
recipes.notes: Apples or rhubarb can be used instead of blueberries. A versatile and delicious dessert.

recipes.title: Rhonda’s Pizza Hotdish
recipes.creator: Rhonda S.
instructions: Brown hamburger/sausage and drain.
While browning meat, cook egg noodles and drain.
Mix all ingredients in a large bowl and then place into a large casserole.
Bake in oven at 350° until heated through.
recipes.notes: Hearty and comforting, perfect for a family dinner.

recipes.title: Adam’s Favorite Crock Pot Beef Stroganoff
recipes.creator: Rhonda S.
ingredients: 1 pkg beef mushroom dry soup mix
instructions: Cut round steak into strips.
Mix the soups in the crockpot.
Add the raw meat and cook on low for 8-10 hours (high for 4-5 hours).
If using sour cream, add it just before serving over the cooked noodles.
recipes.notes: Beefy mushroom dry soup mix can be substituted with any beef dry soup mix.

recipes.title: Chip Dip
recipes.creator: Rhonda S.
instructions: Brown sausage and drain.
Put the tomatoes and cream cheese into a glass bowl. Soften the cream cheese in the microwave for a couple of minutes.
Stir the tomatoes and cream cheese. If not softened, put back in the microwave for a couple more minutes.
Combine the sausage with the tomatoes/cream cheese mixture in a crock pot.
Serve with tortilla chips.
recipes.notes: The 'Scoops' type tortilla chips work really well with this dip.

recipes.title: Cheesy Hashbrowns
recipes.creator: Roxanne S.
instructions: Mix all ingredients in a 9x13 inch pan.
Bake for 1 ½ hours at 350°.
recipes.notes: A simple and comforting cheesy potato dish.

recipes.title: Hotdish
recipes.creator: Roxanne S.
instructions: Brown hamburger and drain.
Mix all ingredients together and bake for 45 min at 350°.
recipes.notes: A unique casserole combining hamburger and Rice Krispies for texture.

recipes.title: Impossible Cheeseburger Pie
recipes.creator: Roxanne S.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°. Grease a 9-inch pie plate.
Brown hamburger and onion together and drain. Stir in salt.
Spread into pie plate and sprinkle with cheese.
Stir remaining ingredients with a fork until blended. Pour into pie plate.
Bake for 25 min or until a knife comes out clean.
recipes.notes: Makes 6 servings. A quick and easy twist on classic cheeseburgers.

recipes.title: Grouse
recipes.creator: Roxanne S.
ingredients: Meat from grouse breast, cut off the bone
½ can of cream of mushroom soup
instructions: Brown meat dipped in flour.
Spread ½ can of cream of mushroom soup into the bottom of a casserole dish.
Place browned meat on top of soup.
Pour the other half of the soup (diluted with milk) over meat.
Bake at 350° for 45-60 min.
recipes.notes: Simple and savory grouse dish, with creamy mushroom soup.

recipes.title: Pheasant
recipes.creator: Roxanne S.
ingredients: Pheasant, browned and dipped in oven fry (for chicken)
1 can cream of chicken soup (diluted with milk)
instructions: Brown the pheasant that has been dipped in oven fry.
Place meat in a casserole dish.
Pour 1 can of cream of chicken soup (diluted with milk) over the top of the meat.
Bake at 350° for 1 ½-2 hours.
recipes.notes: Tender and flavorful pheasant dish, great for a special meal.

recipes.title: Ranch Beans
recipes.creator: Roxanne S.
instructions: Brown hamburger and drain.
Mix all ingredients together.
Bake at 350° for 25-30 min.
recipes.notes: A hearty bean dish that can be customized with bacon and mustard.

recipes.title: Tapioca Jell-o
recipes.creator: Roxanne S.
instructions: Add 2 ½ cups of boiling water to Jell-o and tapioca. Boil for 2 min.
Cool slightly. Add cool whip.
Add frozen strawberries. Chill.
Garnish with cool whip and fruit.
recipes.notes: Substitute with any frozen fruits for variety. A light and refreshing dessert.

recipes.title: Soda Cracker Pie
recipes.creator: Roxanne S.
instructions: Beat egg whites until frothy. Start adding sugar gradually, beat until mixture stands in stiff peaks.
Fold in vanilla, crackers, and walnuts.
Spread evenly in a greased 9-inch pie plate.
Bake at 360° for 30 min and cool.
For topping: beat whipping cream until stiff. Fold in strawberries. Spread over pie and refrigerate for 4 hours or more.
recipes.notes: Makes 6-8 servings. Double recipe for a 9x13 inch pan. A unique pie with a light and crispy base.

recipes.title: Nacho Chips
recipes.creator: Roxanne S.
instructions: Place chips in a cake pan and pour mixture over top.
Bake for a short while.
Top with chopped lettuce.
recipes.notes: A quick and easy nacho dish, perfect for casual gatherings or as a snack.

recipes.title: Nut Goodie Bars
recipes.creator: Roxanne S.
instructions: Melt chocolate chips and butterscotch chips in a double boiler.
Add peanut butter, marshmallows, and peanuts.
Spread into a 9x13 inch pan. Chill.
recipes.notes: A delightful blend of nuts, chocolate, and butterscotch. Chill before serving.

recipes.title: Banana Bread
recipes.creator: Roxanne S.
instructions: Cream shortening, sugar, and eggs.
Stir dry ingredients into creamed mixture.
Add bananas and beat well.
Pour half of the mixture into 2 small greased loaf pans.
Bake at 250° for 40 min or until a toothpick comes out clean.
recipes.notes: Makes 2 loaves. A classic, moist banana bread recipe.

recipes.title: Twix Bars
recipes.creator: Roxanne S.
instructions: First layer: Line the bottom of a 9x13 cake pan with club crackers.
Second layer: Boil margarine, both sugars, graham crackers, and milk for approximately 4 ½ minutes and pour over first layer.
Third layer: Add another layer of club crackers.
Fourth Layer: Melt peanut butter, chocolate chips, and butterscotch chips in the microwave and spread over the third layer.
recipes.notes: A layered treat resembling Twix bars, perfect for satisfying a sweet tooth.

recipes.title: Chicken Rice Soup
recipes.creator: Patti W.
instructions: Heat stock to boiling; add rice, onion, celery, and carrots. Cook slowly.
Melt butter and add flour. Cook approx 2 min.
Stir into soup form.
recipes.notes: A comforting chicken rice soup with a hint of lemon and thyme.

recipes.title: Chicken with Stuffing
recipes.creator: Patti W.
ingredients: 1 can cream of celery or cream of chicken soup
instructions: Mix melted margarine with stuffing. Line a 9x13 inch pan with stuffing mix; reserve some mixture for topping.
Cut cooked chicken into cubes. Put on top of stuffing mix.
Mix sour cream and soup together and pour onto chicken.
Add the rest of the stuffing. Pour chicken broth over stuffing.
Bake at 350° for 45-60 min.
recipes.notes: A satisfying dish combining tender chicken and flavorful stuffing.

recipes.title: Green Bean Casserole
recipes.creator: Patti W.
ingredients: 2 cans (10 oz) cream of mushroom soup
instructions: Mix soup, milk, soy sauce, pepper, beans, and 1 1/3 cup of fried onions in a 3 qt casserole dish.
Bake at 350° for 25 min or until hot.
Stir. Sprinkle remaining fried onions and bake 5 more min.
recipes.notes: Makes 10 servings. A classic holiday side dish loved by many.

recipes.title: Ultimate Baked Potato Soup
recipes.creator: Patti W.
instructions: Bake potatoes at 400° for 1 hour on a cookie sheet. Peel off skins.
In a 4-6 qt stockpot, melt butter. Stir in onions and garlic. Cover and cook until softened, not browned.
Add 2/3 of the potatoes. Mash with a potato masher.
Gradually stir in chicken broth and milk. Add salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer, stirring occasionally.
Cut remaining potatoes into small cubes. Add to soup. Stir gently to reheat.
Sprinkle with cheddar cheese, bacon, and scallions before serving.
recipes.notes: A hearty and comforting soup, perfect for cold days. Toppings add a delicious crunch and flavor.

recipes.title: Chicken Wings
recipes.creator: Patti W.
instructions: Dip wings in flour, brown in butter but do not sear. Place in pan.
Bring sauce ingredients (sugar, soy sauce, water, green pepper) to a boil, spoon over wings.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour, turning after half an hour.
recipes.notes: Savory and slightly sweet wings, perfect for gatherings or a family meal.

recipes.title: Fresh Salsa
recipes.creator: Patti W.
instructions: Combine all ingredients and refrigerate.
recipes.notes: A fresh and flavorful salsa, perfect for dipping or as a condiment.

recipes.title: Orange Bavarian
recipes.creator: Patti W.
instructions: Dissolve Jell-O in water. Stir in sour cream until smooth.
Mix in sherbet until melted.
Chill until partially set.
Fold in oranges.
Pour into a sprayed, 8-inch, ring mold.
Chill.
recipes.notes: Makes 8 servings. A light and refreshing dessert, perfect for gatherings.

recipes.title: Peanut Clusters
recipes.creator: Patti W.
instructions: Melt white bark, semi-sweet chocolate chips, and milk chocolate chips in the microwave on medium, stirring every few minutes.
Stir in the roasted peanuts.
Spoon teaspoon-sized portions onto wax paper.
recipes.notes: Simple and delicious peanut clusters, perfect for a quick sweet treat.

recipes.title: Peanut Cookies
recipes.creator: Patti W.
ingredients: 1 tsp baking soda (in 2 tsp hot water)
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Spoon onto a cookie sheet.
Bake at 350° for 12-15 minutes.
recipes.notes: Crunchy and nutty cookies, a delightful treat for any occasion.

recipes.title: No Bake Cookies
recipes.creator: Patti W.
instructions: Bring milk, shortening, cocoa, salt, and sugar to a rolling boil.
Add oatmeal, coconut, and peanut butter.
Drop by teaspoonfuls and cool.
recipes.notes: Easy and quick to prepare, these cookies are a perfect last-minute dessert.

recipes.title: Buttery Butterscotch Cut-outs
recipes.creator: Patti W.
instructions: In a saucepan, melt butterscotch chips over low heat, stirring constantly until smooth. Pour into a large mixing bowl.
Add all remaining cookie ingredients. Beat at low speed until well mixed.
Divide dough in half, wrap in plastic, refrigerate until firm (about 1 hour).
Heat oven to 375°. On a floured surface, roll out dough to ½ inch thickness. Cut with cookie cutters.
Place on cookie sheet and bake for 5-8 minutes.
For frosting, combine all frosting ingredients. Beat until fluffy. Frost and decorate cookies.
recipes.notes: Makes 4-5 dozen cookies. Fun to decorate and perfect for holidays or special occasions.

recipes.title: Oatmeal Bars
recipes.creator: Patti W.
instructions: Mix oatmeal, shortening, white syrup, and brown sugar together.
Bake at 350° for 10 minutes. Cool.
For frosting, melt chocolate chips and peanut butter together. Spread over cooled bars.
recipes.notes: A simple yet delightful treat combining the flavors of oatmeal and chocolate.

recipes.title: Rhubarb Muffins
recipes.creator: Patti W.
ingredients: Topping: ½ cup sugar, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1 tsp melted butter
instructions: Mix all dry ingredients together, add wet ingredients and rhubarb.
Put in muffin tins and bake at 400° for 20 minutes.
For the topping, mix sugar, cinnamon, and melted butter. Top the muffins after they have cooled.
recipes.notes: Deliciously moist muffins with the tartness of rhubarb, perfect for a spring treat.

recipes.title: White Chocolate Berry Pie
recipes.creator: Patti W.
instructions: Melt 4 squares of chocolate with milk. Cool to room temperature.
Beat cream cheese and sugar in a mixing bowl until smooth. Beat in orange peel and melted chocolate.
Fold in whipped cream. Spread onto crust.
Arrange strawberries on top. Melt remaining chocolate; drizzle over berries.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Keep refrigerated.
recipes.notes: Makes 8 servings. A luxurious dessert with a combination of white chocolate and berries.

recipes.title: Bura Di Beppo’s Garlic Mashed Potatoes
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
instructions: Wash potatoes. Boil until tender and soft. Drain.
Put cooked potatoes in a mixer.
Add butter, cheese, oregano, salt, and garlic.
Mix on low until potatoes are smooth.
recipes.notes: Rich and flavorful garlic mashed potatoes, a perfect side dish for any meal.

recipes.title: Chicken Chili
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
instructions: Add all ingredients into a large pot.
Simmer for 1-2 hours.
recipes.notes: A hearty and flavorful chicken chili, perfect for warming up on chilly days.

recipes.title: Chicken Delight
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
instructions: Place chicken in a baking pan.
Combine dressing, jam, and soup mix. Pour over chicken.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour, or more depending on thickness.
Serve with white or brown rice.
recipes.notes: A sweet and tangy chicken dish, easy to prepare and delicious.

recipes.title: Chow Mein
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
ingredients: ½ lb ground turkey or pork
instructions: Sauté meat until cooked through.
Boil water with bouillon, soy sauce, and celery.
Mix in cornstarch to thicken the sauce.
Pour the meat into the sauce after reaching the desired thickness.
Stir well and serve with white rice and/or chow mein noodles.
recipes.notes: A simple and classic chow mein recipe, easily adaptable to include additional vegetables or ingredients.

recipes.title: Eggplant Meatballs
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
instructions: Cook eggplant in boiling water. Drain and put in a large pot with meat.
Soak bread in water, squeeze dry, tear into pieces, and add to the pot.
Add remaining ingredients.
Mix lightly but thoroughly.
Roll mixture into balls and place in a greased pan.
Bake at 375° for 30-35 minutes.
recipes.notes: A unique twist on traditional meatballs, incorporating eggplant for added flavor and texture.

recipes.title: Sloppy Joe’s
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
instructions: Brown hamburger with onion, salt, and pepper; drain.
Separately, mix and boil ketchup, mustard, vinegar, and sugar.
Combine all ingredients together in a crock-pot.
Simmer on low for a couple of hours.
recipes.notes: A classic Sloppy Joe’s recipe, perfect for a simple and satisfying meal.

recipes.title: Stuffed Shells
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
instructions: Brown sausage and cook shells according to package instructions.
Mix thawed and drained spinach with half of the ricotta, parmesan, mozzarella cheese, and sausage.
Pour Alfredo sauce into the bottom of a pan.
Spoon cheese and sausage mixture into shells and place each shell on top of the sauce.
Pour half a jar of red sauce over shells and sprinkle with remaining cheeses.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes covered and 15 minutes uncovered.
recipes.notes: A hearty and delicious stuffed shell dish, perfect for a comforting family meal.

recipes.title: Chicken Cherry Pasta Salad
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
ingredients: 1 package (16 oz) dry gnocchi or shell pasta
instructions: Combine chicken, pasta, celery, onion, and cherries.
Fold 1 ¾ cups dressing into the salad, reserving ¾ cup.
Cover and chill for several hours or overnight.
Serve with lettuce and remaining dressing.
recipes.notes: An elegant and flavorful pasta salad, great for picnics or as a refreshing side dish.

recipes.title: Club Café Black Bean Salad
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
instructions: Cook and cool brown rice.
Toss all ingredients together.
Refrigerate.
recipes.notes: A vibrant and healthy salad with a refreshing mix of flavors and textures.

recipes.title: Garbanzo Bean Salad
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
ingredients: ¼ tsp cayenne or red pepper
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Refrigerate.
recipes.notes: A refreshing and zesty salad, great as a side dish or a healthy snack.

recipes.title: Broccoli Cheese Soup
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
instructions: Sauté butter, onion, and carrots until tender.
Add water, soup, milk, cheese, and broccoli.
Heat thoroughly, about 20 minutes.
recipes.notes: A creamy and comforting broccoli cheese soup, perfect for chilly evenings.

recipes.title: Banana Chocolate Bread
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
instructions: Cream shortening with sugar. Stir in vanilla. Add eggs. Beat well.
Sift flour with salt and soda. Set aside.
To make sour milk, combine vinegar and milk.
Add alternately with flour to the creamed mixture.
Stir in mashed bananas and chocolate chips.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
recipes.notes: A delightful twist on classic banana bread, enhanced with chocolate chips for added sweetness.

recipes.title: Pin Wheel Pickles
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
instructions: Take 2 pieces of ham or beef, lay out lengthwise overlapping slightly. Spread cream cheese over the top.
Repeat for 2 more layers, creating 3 layers in total.
Dry off pickles, cut off each end. Place a pickle on the meat/cheese layers and roll.
Wrap each pickle in foil and refrigerate until firm.
When ready to serve, slice with a serrated knife.
recipes.notes: A savory and delightful appetizer, perfect for parties or as a snack.

recipes.title: Calico Cheese Dip
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
ingredients: 1 can (2 1/4 oz) sliced ripe olives, drained
instructions: Combine cheese, chilis, olives, onions, tomatoes, and parsley.
Prepare salad dressing according to package directions.
Pour over cheese mixture and mix well.
Serve immediately with tortilla chips.
recipes.notes: A colorful and tasty cheese dip, great for dipping with tortilla chips.

recipes.title: Toffee-Nut Bars
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
ingredients: Bottom layer: ½ cup butter, ½ cup brown sugar, 1 cup flour
Topping: 2 eggs, 1 cup brown sugar, 1 tsp salt, 1 cup chocolate chips, 1 tsp baking powder, 1 TBLS flour
instructions: Mix all ingredients for the bottom layer together and press into an ungreased 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.
For the topping, beat eggs then stir in the rest of the ingredients. Spread on the baked crust.
Return to the 350° oven and bake for 25 minutes.
recipes.notes: A delicious bar with a crunchy base and a rich toffee-nut topping.

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Cookies
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
instructions: Cream butter and sugars, add egg and peanut butter.
Mix flour, soda, and salt. Add to the creamed mixture.
Add oatmeal and chocolate chips.
Shape into balls and place on a baking sheet.
Bake at 350° for 8-10 minutes.
recipes.notes: A classic peanut butter cookie recipe with the delightful addition of chocolate chips.

recipes.title: Spritz Cookies
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
instructions: Cream sugar and butter. Add egg, milk, vanilla, and almond extract.
Add flour and baking powder. Mix well.
Do NOT chill the dough.
Use a cookie press to shape cookies on a baking sheet.
Bake at 400° for 6-8 minutes.
recipes.notes: Delicate and buttery cookies, perfect for holidays or as a sweet treat.

recipes.title: Sugar Cookies
recipes.creator: Sharyl K.
instructions: Mix ingredients thoroughly.
Chill dough and roll into balls.
Dip into sugar and place on an ungreased cookie sheet.
Press with a glass.
Bake at 350° for 8-10 minutes.
recipes.notes: Classic sugar cookies, perfect for decorating or enjoying as is.
